result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald Lynn Bratchett Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Credit of 16 days time served, consecutive to count 3.

- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  Court orders restitution to be paid first.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Credit of 90 days time served, consecutive to count 2. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

miscConds.notes: - Court set restitution at $500.00, made payable to JD.

- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  Court orders restitution to be paid first.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
- Full time work, school or a combination.

- No use of possession of firearms.
- No contact with victim.
- Court will allow 3rd party contact for the purpose of childcare.

- Complete a batters intervention program.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Provide a DNA sample.

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald Lynn Bratchett Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Reginald Lynn Bratchett Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Reginald Lynn Bratchett Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant ordered to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 16 days time served, consecutive to count 3.

AS TO COUNT 3: Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 90 days time served, consecutive to count 2.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

AS TO COUNT 2: Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Complete a batters intervention program.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No contact with victim.
- Court will allow 3rd party contact for the purpose of childcare. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court set restitution at $500.00, made payable to JD.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  Court orders restitution to be paid first.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Reginald Lynn Bratchett Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Reginald Lynn Bratchett Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Defendant Reginald Lynn Bratchett Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Reginald Lynn Bratchett Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Due to court congestion, Court is unable to hear this case.  Court will reschedule case.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Victim Restitution Form
Received and Filed. Victim Impact Statement
Received and Filed. Jury Instruction - Criminal Damage to Property
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions Disorderly Conduct

Defendant Reginald Lynn Bratchett Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Reginald Lynn Bratchett Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Court addressed previously filed bail motion.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies bail motion.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Reginald Lynn Bratchett not in court, in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JAD SJD
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.   Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Reginald Lynn Bratchett in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Reginald Lynn Bratchett in custody.  Nate Mcclure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
 This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
